About Me

Hi! My name is Atiyya Shahab. I'm a graphic designer in Chicago specializing in web, user interface, and user experience design. Many people consider design to be a right brained, intuitive discipline. However, I've been enjoying the the harmony of both logical and intuitive thinking behind design since 2006, when I starting design and coding websites at the age of twelve. I've been honing my craft ever since. I am currently a senior at Columbia College Chicago earning a BFA in Graphic Design with a minor in Web Development. You can view my resume here.

 

Left Brained Skills

I believe that good design requires some left-brained thinking. Organization, order, and reason all all required to make a design that is appropriate and logical.

  • Photoshop & Lightroom
  • Illustrator
  • InDesign
  • Dreamweaver (prefer hand-coding)
  • Premiere Pro
  • Sketch (Bohemian Coding)
  • HTML & CSS
 

Right Brained Skills

Design is boring without right-brained thinking. Good design stands out by doing unexpected thinks, and showing connections that otherwise go unnoticed.

  • Visual Identity Design
  • Web Design & User Interface Design
  • Wire-framing
  • Page Layouts and Print Design
  • Digital Illustration
  • Basic Photography

Contact Me

If you want to contact me, you can use this form, or simply email me at hi@atiyya.net. If you want to connect with me in other ways, check out my social media links below.

I am currently looking for a position that where I can offer my visual design and technical skills, and also be challenged to hone my craft and remain a life-long learner.
